description: These sweet, spicy, and crunchy home fries are perfect to make with a variety of potatoes. Don’t have sweet potatoes on hand? No worries — russets work just fine. And even fingerlings are a great choice!
headline: Indian Home Fries with Peanuts

HowtoTip.text: Storage: Leftovers can be refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 4 days.Adapted from THE MODERN TIFFIN: On-the-Go Vegan Dishes with a Global Flair by Priyanka Naik. Copyright © 2021 Simon & Schuster, Inc. Reprinted by permission of Tiller Press, a Division of Simon & Schuster, Inc.

name: Indian Home Fries with Peanuts
recipeIngredient: 2 Indian green chilies, or 2 serrano or green arbol peppers
1 tablespoon unrefined coconut oil or vegetable oil

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and cut 1 pound sweet potatoes crosswise into 1/8-inch thick slices. Halve 2 green chilies lengthwise. Cut 1/2 medium lemon into 4 wedges. Coarsely chop 1/2 bunch fresh cilantro leaves and tender stems until you have 1/4 cup.

Heat 1 tablespoon coconut or vegetable oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering. Add heaping 1/4 teaspoon cumin seeds and cook until fragrant and starting to pop, 30 seconds to 1 minute.

Add the sweet potatoes, toss to coat with the cumin, and cook 1 minute. Add the chilies, 2 tablespoons of the peanuts, and half the cilantro, and toss to combine. Spread the potatoes out into an even layer and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon kosher salt.
Cook, tossing the potatoes every 5 minutes, until the potatoes are cooked through and charred in spots, about 15 minutes total.

Squeeze 1 lemon wedge over the potatoes, add the remaining cilantro, and toss to combine. Serve garnished with the remaining 1 tablespoon peanuts. Garnish with the remaining 1 tablespoon peanuts. Serve warm or at room temperature with the remaining lemon wedges.
